articles.title: In 2004, Elon Musk discussed partnering with NASA for the next era of space travel. This weekend marks a major milestone
articles.description: In a 2004 interview with CNN, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk discussed his ambitions to partner with NASA and to one day send people into space.

articles.title: Five-month-old Brazilian baby survives coronavirus after 32 days in coma
articles.description: After spending a month in an induced coma due to Covid-19, Dom, a 5-month-old Brazilian baby, gets to go home and celebrate his 6-month birthday.
articles.content:
Sao Paulo, Brazil (CNN)After spending a month in an induced coma due to Covid-19, Dom, a 5-month-old Brazilian baby, gets to go home and celebrate his 6-month birthday.

articles.title: George Floyd killing latest in string of police actions to stoke public anger in Minnesota
articles.description: It's not the first time the long strained relationship between Minneapolis police and the community it is sworn to serve led to demonstrations.

articles.title: Communities band together to clean up

articles.author: Paul Gittings, CNN
articles.title: Robert Lewandowski double as Bayern routs Fortuna to go 10 points clear
articles.description: Goal-machine Robert Lewandowski notched up his 43rd of the season with a double as Bayern Munich crushed Fortuna Dusseldorf 5-0 to go 10 points clear and heading for an eighth straight Bundesliga title Saturday.

articles.title: Volunteers clean up Atlanta after night of protests
articles.description: People and churches have volunteered to clean up following a night of violent protests in Atlanta. CNN's Natasha Chen speaks to some of the volunteers cleaning up the city.

articles.title: Schools struggle with shifting rules on federal coronavirus relief money
articles.description: It's been two months since Congress allocated about $13 billion for K-12 schools in its coronavirus-related emergency aid package -- but the money hasn't yet reached many school districts amid questions over how it should be spent.

articles.title: CDC to resume regular coronavirus briefings after being sidelined by White House

articles.author: Abeer Salman and Andrew Carey, CNN
articles.title: Unarmed Palestinian man shot dead by police in Jerusalem
articles.description: An unarmed Palestinian man has been shot and killed by police at one of the entrances to Jerusalem's Old City on Saturday. Israeli police said officers believed the man had a gun and opened fire on him when he refused to stop for them.

articles.title: Nike is saying 'Don't Do It' in a message about racism in America
articles.description: The brand famously known for its campaign encouraging you to get out there and "Just Do It" is flipping the switch and urging people "Don't Do It" in new messaging focused on race.

articles.author: Martin Goillandeau and Laura Smith-Spark, CNN
articles.title: Crashed PIA flight 'black boxes' to be examined in France
articles.description: Work on the flight data recorder and cockpit voice recorder from a Pakistan International Airlines flight that crashed in Karachi will begin on June 2, French air safety investigators said Saturday on Twitter.
